question.text:
Given below are two statements: one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R.

Assertion A : Experimental reaction of CH3Cl with aniline and anhydrous AlCl3 does not give o and p-methylaniline.

Reason R : The -NH2 group of aniline becomes deactivating because of salt formation with anhydrous AlCl3 and hence yields m-methyl aniline as the product.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below

options.text: Both <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mfenced></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></mfenced></math> are true and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></mfenced></math> is the correct explanation of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mfenced></math>.

Both <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mfenced></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></mfenced></math> are true but <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></mfenced></math> is not the correct explanation of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mfenced></math>.

solution.text: Under the Friedel Craft Reaction condition, the aniline (a Lewis base) binds to the electrophile AlCl3 (a Lewis acid) to give a coordination complex (a salt). Then, the positive charge on the nitrogen is electron withdrawing, and it pulls the electron density of the aromatic ring by -I effect. It therefore, deactivates the ring for further alkylation reactions. Finally, the complex precipitates out of the reaction mixture and the alkylation reaction is not observed.
